item.title: Expert III – Sound artist/audio reporter/sound engineer (category III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Visibility Portfolio for EASE and Environment-related Projects

Global objective

  • To contribute to provide visibility to the impact of EASE, as well as other EU-funded environment and climate change mitigation related interventions in Nigeria.

Specific objective(s)

  • To promote the results of EU funded interventions in Nigeria with environment and climate change mitigation activities, linking them to broader development goals.
  • To raise awareness about the linkages between energy and environmental protection, climate change mitigation.
  • The products under this assignment will form part of the EU Delegation to Nigeria and ECOWAS project portfolio and will be used as PR, media tool and raising awareness material in different events and through different online mediums (websites, print media, social platforms, among others).

The following outputs and deliverables are required:

  • At least 6 success stories, a minimum of 1 page and maximum 1,5 pages per project story in accordance with the visibility guidelines and in a standard format for printing (in Pdf). The stories will include testimonies by beneficiaries and implementing partners, as appropriate.
  • At least 6 videoclips of between 15 and 90 seconds (indicative time), which convey through a succession of images and sounds the projects stories. The videos can include interviews with beneficiaries, partners and project implementers and could be posted online by the delegation, namely on its website and social media (Instagram, facebook, etc), as well as screened at visibility events, in Nigeria.
  • At least 4 audioclips of between 40 and 300 seconds (indicative time), which convey through a succession of sounds the project stories. Some of the footage from the videoclips can be used but the audioclips should have its own creative logic. The sound artist/reporter/engineer is expected to also provide support for sound capture to the videographer, as needed.
  • 150 high-resolution photographs accompanying the pre-selected project stories and reflecting the impact, change and improvements in peoples’ lives and the environment. The photos will depict the activities per project in TIF or RAW, as well as in jpg (low resolution for website use). The contractor should provide the digital storage (hard disks) to support collection of stories mentioned above and to organise the archive. The caption of each photograph should include details such as the location taken, name of the person (for portraits), activity and any other relevant information.
  • 18 photos of all the projects visited should be reworked in detail in post-production (colour correction, touch up, enhancements, all in high resolution for printing) that could serve for a photo exhibition promoting European Cooperation in Nigeria (EU Development Days, Europe Day, Climate Change week, other events). The photos will be printed and made readily available to be exposed.
  • 5 to 10 minutes animated multimedia presentation summarizing the success stories.

Expert III – Sound artist/audio reporter/sound engineer (category III)

Education, and duration of equivalent experience

  • Possession of an undergraduate degree in audio engineering, creative sounds, journalism with a specialisation in audio or equivalent. Equivalent professional experience of more than 3 years is also accepted. Experience
  • Minimum 3 years commercial audio making experience (radio, advertisement) with extensive knowledge of soundscaping and composition demonstrated by portfolio.
  • Experience in audio-reportage projects in the setting of international development cooperation demonstrated by having at least 1 similar project in the portfolio.
  • Ability to work independently as part of a cross-functional team.
  • Proficient in sound editing and treatment software/equipment. The cv will mention which and whether the applicant will have access to them during the mission.
  • Knowledge of EU communication and visibility rules and of EU development cooperation activities will be an advantage.
  • Previous experience of West Africa and, particularly, Nigeria, will be an advantage.

Language skills

  • The expert is required to have proficiency of English both written and oral.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Formulation of the Climate Change and Research (REACH) Programme

The overall objective of this mission is to support the formulation of the REACH programme, a component of the EU’s supports to Agriculture Development in Ghana to be implemented with the resources mobilised under 11th EDF (2014 – 2020) as from 2017 onwards.

In this regard, a fully-fledged Action Document must be produced with annexes, all in line with procedures and standards prevailing for such an Action.

Expert for the Research component (cat II) 43 working days

The expert must be graduated in social studies, agro/socio economy or related fields with at least a Master Degree. Alternatively, he may have an equivalent professional experience of at least 2 years on top of the general required experience.

General required experience: The expert must have at least 6 years of general experience of scientific duties implemented at ground level (in an university/research centre, academia or M&E units of a well-known institution) or any other related activities aiming at using social sciences as a management tool for programmes in an African context. A confirmed experience in conducting research works in sociology, anthropology, agroecology, or ability to conduct prospective studies on social transformation, environmental matters or climate change will be considered as an asset.

Specific required experience: 1/ Fields to be covered: Evaluation/management of Development Projects on minimum 2 among the 3 below-listed sectors:

  • Livelihood resilience, social safety net, local governance, right based approach;
  • Carbon sequestration, soil degradation, agro-bio-diversity;
  • Environment protection/ management of natural resources;
  • Climate adaptation/mitigation.

2/ At least one field of the list below constitutes a minimum requirement (all fields will be scored maximum):

  • In-depth knowledge of European and African research institutes;
  • Proven knowledge regarding the state of play of Research in tropical countries by topics (resilience, sustainable agriculture, land degradation, climate-proof systems, carbon sequestration, soil degradation, ,…)
  • Capacity to justify the various research works (prospective research, quantitative research, statistic collection and data interpretation,…) through cooperation programmes in Africa, particularly sub-Saharan Africa including Ghana;
  • Formulation of programmes (ability for reasoning and strategizing ideas).

Experience in Ghana will be considered as an additional advantage.

item.title: Deux Experts de Catégorie I - Evaluation Finale du Programme PADIC
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
L'objectif général de la présente mission est de réaliser, au profit de l'Union européenne une évaluation finale du programme PADIC et faire des recommandations pour une éventuelle, future intervention dans le domaine de la decentralisation territorial au Burkina Faso. L'évaluation permettra aussi de renforcer et d’orienter les objectifs futures et les possibles interventions 11° FED vis-à-vis du contexte actuel.

L’équipe sera composée de deux experts de catégorie I (50 h/j en total – 2 x 25 jours).

Catégorie et durée de l'expérience équivalente

  • Au moins 12 années d'expérience professionnelle dans les secteurs liés aux droits humaines et à la bonne gouvernance.
  • Expérience en décentralisation/finances locales (mise en œuvre et/ou évaluation) considérée comme un atout ;
  • Connaissance approfondie de la coopération entre l'UE et les pays d'Afrique de l'Ouest ou Centrale, de préférence avec le Burkina Faso.

*Formation * Niveau Bac + 4 en économie, sciences politiques, sciences sociales ou équivalent. Un niveau de formation inférieur peut être compensé par une expérience professionnelle pertinente dans le domaine concerné.

*Expérience *

  • Bonne connaissance des procédures FED ;
  • Expérience en Afrique de l'Ouest. Une expérience au Burkina Faso serait un atout ;
  • Expérience dans les pays en développement et en Afrique Sub-saharienne en matière de conseil/appui à la décentralisation, à la gouvernance locale et/ou aux financements locaux des pays d’Afrique francophone. Une bonne connaissance des enjeux au Burkina Faso serait un atout ;
  • Bonne connaissance des appuis institutionnels et des questions de renforcement des capacités ;
  • Bonne connaissance des évaluations de projets. Avoir déjà réalisé au moins une mission d'évaluation d'un programme appui à la décentralisation financé par le FED sera considéré comme un atout ;
  • Expérience dans la conception, la mise en œuvre de systèmes de suivi/évaluation des politiques nationales ;
  • Bonnes connaissances en matière d'appui à des centres de recherches universitaires et/ou à des écoles supérieures seraient un atout ;
  • Bonne connaissance du cycle de projet.
